verses.roman:
pṛthūdakaṁ bindu-saras
tritakūpaṁ sudarśanam
viśālaṁ brahma-tīrthaṁ ca
cakraṁ prācīṁ sarasvatīm

yamunām anu yāny eva
gaṅgām anu ca bhārata
jagāma naimiṣaṁ yatra
ṛṣayaḥ satram āsate

synonyms: pṛthu—broad; udakam—whose water; bindu-saraḥ—the lake Bindu-sarovara; trita-kūpam sudarśanam—the pilgrimage places known as Tritakūpa and Sudarśana; viśālam brahma-tīrtham ca—Viśāla and Brahma-tīrtha; cakram—Cakra-tīrtha; prācīm—flowing east; sarasvatīm—the Sarasvatī River; yamunām—the Yamunā River; anu—along; yāni—which; eva—all; gaṅgām—the Ganges; anu—along; ca—also; bhārata—O descendant of Bharata (Parīkṣit Mahārāja); jagāma—He visited; naimiṣam—the Naimiṣa forest; yatra—where; ṛṣayaḥ—great sages; satram—an elaborate sacrifice; āsate—were performing.
translation: Lord Balarāma visited the broad Bindu-saras Lake, Tritakūpa, Sudarśana, Viśāla, Brahma-tīrtha, Cakra-tīrtha and the eastward-flowing Sarasvatī. He also went to all the holy places along the Yamunā and the Ganges, O Bhārata, and then He came to the Naimiṣa forest, where great sages were performing an elaborate sacrifice.
